. Earlier on Sunday, Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand told US television that she had visited with Gabrielle Giffords the previous day and found her "doing great" and "making progress every day." Gabrielle Giffords is using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand told NBC's Meet The Press program. The decision for Larry Page to take off the CEO training wheels comes at an auspicious moment in the history of Google. I won't overdramatize this step by saying "Google is at a crossroads" or The company's future hangs in the balance. But at no time since the Google juggernaut began its conquest of the Internet have their been so many doubts being raised about the company's future.
